greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n)=1 if n is a prime number; otherwise, a(n)=n.
reference: Paulo Ribenboim, The little book of big primes, Springer 1991, p. 106.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: a[n_] := ((n-1)! + 1)/n - Floor[(n-1)!/n] // Denominator; Table[a[n] , {n, 1, 63}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 17 2013, after Minac's formula *)
program: (MAGMA) [IsPrime(n) select 1 else n: n in [1..70]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 22 2013
results.author: _Mohammad K. Azarian_, Dec 01 2007
